Line 9: Line 9:
{{Main|Tombstone (comics)}}
{{Main|Tombstone (comics)}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Keith David]] (Survival of the Fittest), [[Kevin Michael Richardson]] (All other episodes)
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Keith David]] (Survival of the Fittest), [[Kevin Michael Richardson]] (All other episodes)
â
[[Image:TombstoneSpectacularSpiderMan2.png|thumb|210px|Tombstone.]]
 
As one of the lead antagonist's of the series, L. Thompson Lincoln is believed by Spider-Man to be the true identity of the "Big Man," though he says he's gone by many names, his favorite being Tombstone. Tombstone is one of the few villains to best Spider-Man in a fight.
As one of the lead antagonist's of the series, L. Thompson Lincoln is believed by Spider-Man to be the true identity of the "Big Man," though he says he's gone by many names, his favorite being Tombstone. Tombstone is one of the few villains to best Spider-Man in a fight.
Line 27: Line 26:
{{Main|Hammerhead (comics)}}
{{Main|Hammerhead (comics)}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[John DiMaggio]]
* '''Voice Actor''': [[John DiMaggio]]
â
[[Image:SpectacularHammerhead.jpg|thumb|200px|Hammerhead.]]
 
Hammerhead was originally Tombstone's second in command, and organized much of the mysterious Big Man's criminal empire, providing its face (and more frequently, muscle) in its various dealings. It was through Hammerhead that the Big Man made a deal with Norman Osborn to continue making supervillains so Spider-Man would be too distracted to stop the Big Man's operations. He also once worked for Silvermane, and had a relationship with his daughter, Sable. They broke up, but there is a differing opinion over whom was responsible and why.
Hammerhead was originally Tombstone's second in command, and organized much of the mysterious Big Man's criminal empire, providing its face (and more frequently, muscle) in its various dealings. It was through Hammerhead that the Big Man made a deal with Norman Osborn to continue making supervillains so Spider-Man would be too distracted to stop the Big Man's operations. He also once worked for Silvermane, and had a relationship with his daughter, Sable. They broke up, but there is a differing opinion over whom was responsible and why.
Line 48: Line 46:
{{Main|Montana (comics)}}
{{Main|Montana (comics)}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Jeff Bennett]]
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Jeff Bennett]]
â
[[Image:Spectacularshocker.jpg|thumb|right|Montana as Shocker]]
 
Montana is the field leader of the Enforcers and is a trained mercenary. Despite his criminal activities, he is very much a professional, having no personal grudge with Spider-Man, just considering it his responsibility to bring him down. Though Spider-Man's antics can wear on his nerves (and frequently do). He speaks with a southern accent and enjoys wearing a cowboy hat when out of uniform.
Montana is the field leader of the Enforcers and is a trained mercenary. Despite his criminal activities, he is very much a professional, having no personal grudge with Spider-Man, just considering it his responsibility to bring him down. Though Spider-Man's antics can wear on his nerves (and frequently do). He speaks with a southern accent and enjoys wearing a cowboy hat when out of uniform.
Line 89: Line 86:
{{Main|Vulture (comics)}}
{{Main|Vulture (comics)}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Robert Englund]]
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Robert Englund]]
â
[[Image:Www.spidey2.jpg|thumb|218px|Vulture.]]
 
Adrian Toomes is an elderly scientist tricked by Norman Osborn to reveal his plans for flying technology, not knowing that Osborn was planning on stealing his invention and blaming his friend Octavius until he learns the truth. After Osborn showed no remorse for his actions, Toomes donned his own flying suit and dubbed himself Vulture (based on an insult Norman had given him earlier in the day) in order to force Norman to apologize until Spider-Man stopped him by attacking Vulchie`s humming hump.
Adrian Toomes is an elderly scientist tricked by Norman Osborn to reveal his plans for flying technology, not knowing that Osborn was planning on stealing his invention and blaming his friend Octavius until he learns the truth. After Osborn showed no remorse for his actions, Toomes donned his own flying suit and dubbed himself Vulture (based on an insult Norman had given him earlier in the day) in order to force Norman to apologize until Spider-Man stopped him by attacking Vulchie`s humming hump.

[[Image:Spectacularelectro.jpeg|thumb|205px|Electro.]]
 
Maxwell Dillon was a young 20 year old electrician and a friend of Dr. Curt Connors until he suffered a terrible accident which transformed him into the supervillain Electro.
Maxwell Dillon was a young 20 year old electrician and a friend of Dr. Curt Connors until he suffered a terrible accident which transformed him into the supervillain Electro.

Line 130: Line 124:
{{Main|Sandman (Marvel Comics)}}
{{Main|Sandman (Marvel Comics)}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[John DiMaggio]]
* '''Voice Actor''': [[John DiMaggio]]
â
[[Image:Competition Spectacular Spider-Man.jpg|202px|thumb|Sandman.]]
 
Flint Marko is introduced as a petty crook, seen working alongside Alex O'Hirn under the Big Man. He had been captured by Spider-Man twice before the start of the series, and several times afterwards as well, usually with relative ease. Unlike his partner O'Hirn, Marko's motivation remained solely to seek out money despite Spider-Man's constant foilings, referring to his eventual goal as getting his "big score."
Flint Marko is introduced as a petty crook, seen working alongside Alex O'Hirn under the Big Man. He had been captured by Spider-Man twice before the start of the series, and several times afterwards as well, usually with relative ease. Unlike his partner O'Hirn, Marko's motivation remained solely to seek out money despite Spider-Man's constant foilings, referring to his eventual goal as getting his "big score."
Line 144: Line 137:
{{Main|Rhino (comics)}}
{{Main|Rhino (comics)}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Clancy Brown]]
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Clancy Brown]]
â
[[Image:Rhino-2-.jpg|thumb|right|Rhino]]
 
At first Alexander "Alex" O'Hirn is just a petty crook, seen working with Flint Marko under orders of the Big Man. He is captured by Spider-Man with ease times and time again, which increases his annoyance and hatred of Spider-Man. Unlike his partner, money is a secondary interest to him, his primary one being revenge.
At first Alexander "Alex" O'Hirn is just a petty crook, seen working with Flint Marko under orders of the Big Man. He is captured by Spider-Man with ease times and time again, which increases his annoyance and hatred of Spider-Man. Unlike his partner, money is a secondary interest to him, his primary one being revenge.
Line 156: Line 148:
{{Main|Green Goblin}}
{{Main|Green Goblin}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Alan Rachins]] (as Osborn), [[Steven Blum]] (as Green Goblin)
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Alan Rachins]] (as Osborn), [[Steven Blum]] (as Green Goblin)
â
[[Image:Catalysts SSM.jpg|thumb|right|Green Goblin.]]
 
Norman is Harry's strict, domineering father and dirty-dealing CEO of OsCorp. Norman never apologizes, even when he is wrong and goes to any length to make the most money, including stealing [[Vulture (comics)|Adrian Toomes']] flight technology and later, through criminal activities of an even more despicable nature. Even after he was saved by Spider-Man from Vulture's wrath, he insists on having nothing to do with him, so as to keep business propositions between him and Tombstone open.
Norman is Harry's strict, domineering father and dirty-dealing CEO of OsCorp. Norman never apologizes, even when he is wrong and goes to any length to make the most money, including stealing [[Vulture (comics)|Adrian Toomes']] flight technology and later, through criminal activities of an even more despicable nature. Even after he was saved by Spider-Man from Vulture's wrath, he insists on having nothing to do with him, so as to keep business propositions between him and Tombstone open.
Line 176: Line 167:
{{Main|Doctor Octopus}}
{{Main|Doctor Octopus}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Peter MacNicol]]
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Peter MacNicol]]
â
[[Image:Spectacular Doc Ock.jpg|thumb|right|232px|Doctor Octopus.]]
 
Dr. Octavius is a research scientist working under Norman Osborn at OsCorp. He is very timid and willing to apologize for every little thing, a direct contrast to his boss, Norman. He is one of OsCorp's most intelligent scientists and the creator of a four armed harness that makes him able to do dangerous experiments, playing a part in the creation of Sandman and Rhino.
Dr. Octavius is a research scientist working under Norman Osborn at OsCorp. He is very timid and willing to apologize for every little thing, a direct contrast to his boss, Norman. He is one of OsCorp's most intelligent scientists and the creator of a four armed harness that makes him able to do dangerous experiments, playing a part in the creation of Sandman and Rhino.
Line 198: Line 188:
{{Main|Chameleon (comics)}}
{{Main|Chameleon (comics)}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Steven Blum]]
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Steven Blum]]
â
[[Image:ChameleonSSM2008.png|thumb|200px|Chameleon.]]
 
The Chameleon is an international spy-for-hire, master of disguise and a former [[Federal Security Service (Russia)|FSB]] agent, the Chameleon and his partners Quentin Beck and Phineas Mason were hired by a mysterious 'General' to steal the alien symbiote from Dr. Connors' lab. After failing that mission, Chameleon began to frame Spider-Man for crimes until the combined forces of Spider-Man and Black Cat defeated them. Beck and Mason were arrested, but Chameleon disguised himself as the policeman Stan Carter and escaped.
The Chameleon is an international spy-for-hire, master of disguise and a former [[Federal Security Service (Russia)|FSB]] agent, the Chameleon and his partners Quentin Beck and Phineas Mason were hired by a mysterious 'General' to steal the alien symbiote from Dr. Connors' lab. After failing that mission, Chameleon began to frame Spider-Man for crimes until the combined forces of Spider-Man and Black Cat defeated them. Beck and Mason were arrested, but Chameleon disguised himself as the policeman Stan Carter and escaped.
Line 211: Line 200:
Soon after, Spider-Man merges with an alien symbiote brought to the Connors' lab which had been found attached to a space ship piloted by John Jameson. Eddie is subsequently fired from his job at Empire State University due to a lack of funding after the alien's disappearance. When Spider-Man manages to separate from the symbiote, he returns it to the ESU labs, raising Eddie's hopes of gaining his job back. However, his last hope is shattered when Spider-Man attempts to destroy it. The surviving alien, which feeds off of negative emotions, could sense Eddie's anger and deeply repressed hatred and pain. It subsequently bonded with him, revealing to him Spider-Man's identity as Peter Parker making him the first and only person in the series so far to figure out his secret identity. Together, they formed the creature known as "Venom", which refers to itself as "we".
Soon after, Spider-Man merges with an alien symbiote brought to the Connors' lab which had been found attached to a space ship piloted by John Jameson. Eddie is subsequently fired from his job at Empire State University due to a lack of funding after the alien's disappearance. When Spider-Man manages to separate from the symbiote, he returns it to the ESU labs, raising Eddie's hopes of gaining his job back. However, his last hope is shattered when Spider-Man attempts to destroy it. The surviving alien, which feeds off of negative emotions, could sense Eddie's anger and deeply repressed hatred and pain. It subsequently bonded with him, revealing to him Spider-Man's identity as Peter Parker making him the first and only person in the series so far to figure out his secret identity. Together, they formed the creature known as "Venom", which refers to itself as "we".
â
[[File:Venom in Spectacular Spider-Man.jpg|thumb|220px|Venom.]]
+
After Venom attempts to stalk and threaten him out of irrational vengeance, Spider-Man tricks the symbiote into leaving Eddie by pretending he wanted to rejoin with it. After successfully deflecting the Symbiote's attempt to regain control, Spider-Man captures it and dumps it in wet cement at a local construction site.
After Venom attempts to stalk and threaten him out of irrational vengeance, Spider-Man tricks the symbiote into leaving Eddie by pretending he wanted to rejoin with it. After successfully deflecting the Symbiote's attempt to regain control, Spider-Man captures it and dumps it in wet cement at a local construction site.
Line 227: Line 216:
{{Main|Mysterio}}
{{Main|Mysterio}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Xander Berkeley]]
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Xander Berkeley]]
â
[[Image:SpectacularMysterio.jpg|thumb|204px|Mysterio.]]
 
Beck was originally one of the Chameleon's partners in crime. He is described by the Chameleon as being a master of special effects and illusions. He is arrested along with Phineas Mason at the end of the episodes while Chameleon escapes.
Beck was originally one of the Chameleon's partners in crime. He is described by the Chameleon as being a master of special effects and illusions. He is arrested along with Phineas Mason at the end of the episodes while Chameleon escapes.
Line 283: Line 271:
{{Main|Molten Man}}
{{Main|Molten Man}}
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Eric Lopez]]
* '''Voice Actor''': [[Eric Lopez]]
â
[[Image:Molten Man - The Spectacular Spider-Man TV Series.PNG|thumb|190px|Molten Man.]]
 
Mark Allan is Liz Allan's brother. He first appeared in "First Steps" where it was mentioned that he just got out of juvenile hall. Mark works in the school play, and develops interest in Mary Jane Watson, who returns the favor. Later, his crush on her develops, and the two agree to go on a date on Valentine's Day. However, when Peter left the party to fight Doctor Octopus, Silvermane and Tombstone, and returned later, Mark told Peter that he and Liz know that Peter is still wanting Gwen, and he warns Peter by telling him that Liz is too good for him.
Mark Allan is Liz Allan's brother. He first appeared in "First Steps" where it was mentioned that he just got out of juvenile hall. Mark works in the school play, and develops interest in Mary Jane Watson, who returns the favor. Later, his crush on her develops, and the two agree to go on a date on Valentine's Day. However, when Peter left the party to fight Doctor Octopus, Silvermane and Tombstone, and returned later, Mark told Peter that he and Liz know that Peter is still wanting Gwen, and he warns Peter by telling him that Liz is too good for him.
